intro: Grangea minuta, commonly known as the slender grangea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It has opposite, simple leaves that are often hairy and have a distinct, elongated shape. Grangea minuta thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
